intro: Odontadenia stemmadeniifolia, commonly known as the mountain hakea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and dense, needle-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in cylindrical inflorescences. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Odontadenia stemmadeniifolia is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing its resilience to drought.
